intro: Satureja spicigera, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, lance-shaped leaves that have a strong, pungent scent. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem, and it produces small, four-lobed fruits. Satureja spicigera is often used in traditional herbal medicine and as a seasoning due to its aromatic properties.
